#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Create a Targeted Advertisement on Facebook and Instagram
#Text=Advertising is the best way to display and deliver products and services to the right people .
#Text=What better way of advertising is there than through social media , particularly Facebook which has 1.86 billion active users and Instagram with 800 million active users .
#Text=Since Instagram is owned by Facebook , advertising on both simultaneously is a seamless process .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Setting up the Campaign
#Text=Click on the link titled ads from the Facebook.com dashboard .
#Text=This will load the Facebook Ads Manager .
#Text=Press close in the left tab .
#Text=You could technically start creating the ads from here .
#Text=However , for simplicity 's sake , we 'll start the ad creating process in a more efficient way .
#Text=Click on the Campaigns tab if it is n't displayed by default .
#Text=Then click on Create Campaign .
#Text=Name your advertisement and select the campaign objective .
#Text=This will decide how the ad 's funds will be spent and will help you keep track of your advertisement campaign .
#Text=Once you 're done , click on save to draft .
#Text=You can create a generic name for your advertisement .
#Text=This will not be displayed publicly so do n't worry about it .
#Text=Here you can also select the campaign objective .
#Text=By default Facebook has selected gaining traffic .
#Text=This is the most optimal form of advertising but it is important to select whichever one fits your needs .
#Text=You can change this later .
#Text=Select your country , currency , and time zone under the tab : Ad Account .
#Text=Beginning the Advertisement
#Text=Click on the dashboard select the tab titled Ads . , and click on Create Ad .
#Text=Select the campaign you have created under Use Existing ' . Then , select Use Guided Creation .
#Text=if the option appears .
#Text=Otherwise , just move on .
#Text=Select the marketing objective .
#Text=There are three broad categories to choose from , select the one relevant to your goal .
#Text=At this point , the one you chose will determine the structure of your advertisement .
#Text=Once done , select Continue .
#Text=Creating the Ad Set and Targeting an Audience
#Text=Choose where you want your advertisement traffic will be driven .
#Text=Under the Audience section , select who you will see your advertisement done , which is achieved through Facebook 's advertising algorithm .
#Text=Custom Audience is used to target individual users by their username from outside sources such as a third party website .
#Text=This is mainly for large companies .
#Text=Under Locations , choose where your advertisement is displayed .
#Text=You can select multiple towns , cities , states/provinces , and countries .
#Text=Select the age range of users that will see your advertisement as well as the gender of these users .
#Text=Detailed Targeting is the most important aspect of a well-designed advertisement .
#Text=Here you can select from a near infinite amount of subgroups you want to see your advertisements , each demographic will also display how many users fall under the category .
#Text=You can also exclude certain demographics .
#Text=You can click Save This Audience so you do n't accidentally lose your progress .
#Text=Under Placements select the option Edit Placements .
#Text=Here you can select where on Facebook and Instagram your advertisement will appear .
#Text=Under Budget and Schedule you can decide how much you want to spend on your advertisement daily .
#Text=The more money you spend the more users will be projected to see your advertisement , but there 's no guarantee that that amount will see it daily .
#Text=Once done , select Continue
#Text=Creating the Displayed Advertisement for Facebook and Instagram
#Text=For Identity
#Text=select the Facebook page you created that you want displayed with the ad .
#Text=Under Format and Imaged you can choose whether you want one image , multiple images , or a video displayed as your visual advertisement .
#Text=Upload an image you wish to be displayed in your advertisement .
#Text=You can upload up to six photos that will be displayed .
#Text=Under the Links section you will decide what headline and description you want displayed with the picture(s)/video .
#Text=Be original , but most importantly , draft something that will grab the attention of your audience .
#Text=Here you also paste the link you want your advertisement to go to .
#Text=This can be a product , a website , an affiliate marketing link , another social media account , etc.
#Text=As you finish up your advertisement , an example of your ad will start to render in the left panel .
#Text=Finishing Moves
#Text=Link a payment method that Facebook will charge monthly ( until it is canceled ) .
#Text=Before your advertisement goes live , Facebook will first analyze it for errors , false advertising , or for violating their terms of service .
#Text=This usually wo n't take longer than a day .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Facebook account
#Text=Facebook page
#Text=Debit or credit card with enough balance to pay for a one time or recurring payment
#Text=Video
